group_1.textLeft: Huh…?! Wait, ignore that move—!

group_1.textRight: What other moves do you have? You lose.

group_1.textLeft: Ugh…how many times in a row have I lost…?
I don't think I can ever beat you again!

group_1.textRight: You're so honest at heart.
In general I can tell exactly what's on@your mind.
You close your eyes when you lie, and they dart@around when you're questioned…

group_1.textLeft: Eh…?

group_1.textRight: You're not even aware of it, are you?

group_1.textLeft: Huh… Now that you point it out…!
…But still, this is a game that comes down to@the roll of the dice…
How is it possible for me to always get trounced@this badly?

group_1.textRight: You need to read your opponent correctly and@make the move with the best chance of winning.

group_1.textLeft: It feels like you're suddenly distant,@Lady Cornelia…
That noise…@Did it come from the courtyard?

group_1.textRight: Yes…@That must be Himena and the others!

group_1.textLeft: …So it was you after all!

group_1.textRight: Cornelia's grown again since we last met, yeah?
How long has it been since we last met?

group_1.textLeft: Err…maybe a year now?

group_1.textRight: …That long…?!

group_1.textLeft: Sir Hilarus the Left-Handed has also become@incredibly popular.

group_1.textRight: Can you inform us of the current situation?
78 CE…
There's just a little more than a year before@Mount Vesuvius erupts.
But things seem to have changed significantly@thanks to their efforts.

group_1.narration: "As a result of the cooperation of various groups,@including the Cult of Isis, there are now rumors@that Mount Vesuvius will soon erupt in flame…"

"Furthermore, in consequence to the rise in large@tremors, seemingly in tandem with these rumors…@some influential people, including Cornelia's father,@have begun considering relocating their trade,@and residents have begun migrating to other towns."
"These developments have affected the elections.@Even among those in the city council,@there's a movement to consider evacuation@and relocation over reconstruction…"

group_1.textLeft: I feel guilty for causing such anxiety, and yet…

group_1.textRight: There's no avoiding that the eruption is going@down in about a year.

group_1.textLeft: While other towns are getting more motivated@to evacuate in the event of an emergency,
Pompeii…is still in debate.

group_1.textRight: So Pompeii is the biggest problem…?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, because the Pompeii city council is still@mainly composed of reconstructionists.
Still, we're trying to approach this in various@ways…

group_1.textRight: Like Marius and Cornelia's engagement,@right?

group_1.textLeft: Of course!
Considering the influence Lord Marius's father@holds…
The outcome of the engagement will determine@the council's will.
I think that's the main component of our plan.

group_1.textRight: And how are things going with Cornelia@and Marius?

group_1.textLeft: It's not official yet, but I wager it's only a matter@of time before the engagement is finalized.
In fact, I've even come today with a message@from Lord Marius.

group_1.textRight: You're still playing carrier pigeon for them…
Aren't you supposed to be Junia's handmaiden?

group_1.textLeft: Lady Junia herself asked me to help, actually.

group_1.textRight: Dang, she's really pulling for you guys, huh?!

group_1.textLeft: But…if we're to save everyone's lives, we need@to sway the public on a grand scale.
And I know just the man who can help us@with that.

group_1.textRight: Who is it?

group_1.textLeft: Admiral Plinius, the man who published@the Naturalis Historia.

group_1.narration: "Gaius Plinius Secundus…@A military man and naturalist renowned for@his thirty-seven volume Naturalis Historia,@and an intellectual who will be remembered@for ages to come."
"Naturalis Historia is close to what@we would now call an encyclopedia…"
"It is famous for the vast knowledge it@contains on geography and astronomy,@as well as its documentation on creatures@of myth, such as the unicorn and the phoenix…"

group_1.textCenter: …As an intellectual, he would be aware of@earthquakes and other unusual phenomena.
Perhaps he has observed that they are@indicators of volcanic eruptions.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, and Master Plinius is deeply involved@with Lord Vespasian,
as well as the central figures of Rome.
Not to mention that he's the commander of@Rome's greatest fleet.
If we could get him to vouch for a full@evacuation of the city…!
Are earth tremors considered an omen of@disaster in the future?

group_1.textRight: Water vein anomalies and increased quakes are@both linked to deformation in the earth's crust.
They are considered to be events leading to@volcanic eruption.

group_1.textLeft: I see.
Perhaps the wise Master Plinius has observed@the ongoing anomalies,
and can draw the correct insights from them…

group_1.textRight: But how are we supposed to talk to him?@He's a really big deal, isn't he?

group_1.textLeft: I may be able to have my father introduce us?
I've tried to contact him myself, but it seems@he's a very busy man…
So let's take a chance and go for it!

group_1.textRight: How…?

group_1.textLeft: Master Plinius is in our range as we speak.
He's stationed in Misenum, on Pompeii's@opposite shore.
We're planning to travel there using one of@Lord Cornelius's merchant ships!
Now I'm just trying to figure out how we can@reach out to him…

group_1.textRight: Hmm, hmm… Well, I guess we have to actually@get there first.

group_1.textLeft: Something up, Nemurin?

group_1.textRight: No… There's just something I hadn't mentioned@earlier.
Plinius is doomed to die in the coming eruption.
He was on a mission to investigate and rescue a@friend during the eruption of Mount Vesuvius.
He landed at Stabiae near Pompeii, where he@met his demise.
His nephew's letter describing this event…
…is a valuable source of information on the@eruption of Mount Vesuvius.
It's one that has survived to the present day.
